title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Decision Perspective: Individual decision analysis and behavioural decision theory, Interactive decision-making – non-cooperative game theory, and joint decision making – negotiation analysis. Two-party Distributive Negotiations: Distributed bargaining problem, reservation price, Dealing with complexities of uncertainty and time, Auctions and bids. Two-Party Integrative (Win-Win) Negotiations: Design, evaluation and analysis of Template-Fote, Scorable negotiation simulation, Non-cooperative negotiations. Third-Party Intervention: facilitation and mediation, Arbitration – the mid-mid and the balanced increment solution, Parallel negotiations. Multi-Party Negotiation: Group decisions, Consensus, Coalitions, Voting, Pluralistic parties, Multi-party interventions. Book •Raiffa, H. (2005) Negotiation Analysis, Prentice Hall of India Pvt. Ltd, New Delhi, 2005, ND.
